title.rendered: Savour the Flavours of The County: The Drake Devonshire Joins Countylicious 2025

slim_seo.title: Savour the Flavours of The County: The Drake Devonshire Joins Countylicious 2025 - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Countylicious is more than a culinary event — it’s a love letter to Prince Edward County. It’s about place, community, and the makers who turn good ingredients into great experiences. From October 23rd to November 16th, restaurants across The County will serve menus inspired by the season, inviting diners to taste new adventures and revisit old favourites. At Drake Devonshire, food isn’t just served — it tells a tale. For this year’s Countylicious, Executive Chef Amanda Ray has composed a menu that captures autumn in The County, plate by plate. Think of it as edible storytelling, with each dish a chapter full of colour, flavour, and a wink of warmth. Our lunch and dinner menus are a playful parade of the season: velvety pumpkin soup that hugs you from the inside, a beet salad bursting with autumn jewel tones, and a tahini salmon bowl that’s bold. Classics get a cheeky twist — fried chicken burger? Yes, please. Piri piri chicken? Bring on the heat. Seared trout? Done to perfection. And just when you think it’s over, a curated cheese board arrives — the perfect encore of artisanal cheeses paired with preserves that taste like The County itself. Each plate speaks — of what grows here and the hands that make it possible. Countylicious is your invitation to taste those stories, and there’s no better stage for the show than Drake Devonshire. Countylicious is about celebrating everything that makes Prince Edward County special — the season, the produce, and the people who bring it to life,” says Executive Chef Amanda Ray. “For this menu, I wanted to capture the comfort of autumn with dishes that tell a story. Each plate is inspired by the harvest, crafted with care, and designed to connect diners to the heart of The County. So, pull up a chair. Take part in the story. Make Drake Devonshire your Countylicious destination this season. Reserve your table now — your tastebuds will thank you. Fall in Prince Edward County – Beyond Countylicious Fall Festivals Worth the Trip: Scarecrow Festival at Macaulay Museum (Oct 12-13): Create your own scarecrow and explore whimsical seasonal displays. Candlelight Graveyard + Gallows Tours (Oct 16-23): A lantern-lit history tour with eerie and memorable tales. Wellington Pumpkinfest (Oct 18): The crown jewel of PEC’s autumn calendar, featuring a lively parade, giant pumpkin weigh-offs, contests, food stalls, and live entertainment. Why Visit Prince Edward County in Fall? Fall offers the best of both worlds — the buzz of festivals paired with the peace of off-season travel. Vibrant colours, seasonal flavours, and a slower pace make it a season to savour. For those planning their trip, linking directly to official event pages and including location tags such as “Prince Edward County fall events” or “things to do in PEC this fall” will make this guide a strong resource for both visitors and search engines. Adding photos of festivals and alt text describing each scene will further boost discoverability. Fall in Prince Edward County is nothing short of magic — so pack your sweater, grab a pumpkin-spiced something, and head to the County to make your own story this season. And don’t forget — Countylicious is your perfect culinary chapter in that story.
